title: 2020)) after consultation with the Minister for Justice, hereby order as follows:
heading: 1. This Order may be cited as the Criminal Justice (Mutual Assistance)
text_raw:
1. This Order may be cited as the Criminal Justice (Mutual Assistance) 

Act 2008 (Designation of United Kingdom) Order 2020.
text_norm: 1 order may cited criminal justice (mutual assistance) act 2008 (designation united kingdom) order 2020

title: 2020)) after consultation with the Minister for Justice, hereby order as follows:

text_raw:
2. This Order shall come into operation at 11:00pm on the 31st day of 

December 2020.

title: 2020)) after consultation with the Minister for Justice, hereby order as follows:
heading: 3. The United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland is
text_raw:
3. The United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland is 
designated for the purposes of mutual assistance between the State and that 
state under the Criminal Justice (Mutual Assistance) Act 2008 (No. 7 of 2008) 
in accordance with the relevant international instruments mentioned in the 
Schedule to this Order. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 8th January, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [718] 3
text_norm: 3 united kingdom great britain northern ireland designated purpose mutual assistance state state criminal justice (mutual assistance) act 2008 (no 7 2008) accordance relevant international instrument mentioned schedule order notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 8th january 2021 718 3

title: 2020)) after consultation with the Minister for Justice, hereby order as follows:
heading: European Convention on Mutual Assistance in Criminal Matters, done at
text_raw:
SCHEDULE 

European Convention on Mutual Assistance in Criminal Matters, done at 
Strasbourg on 20 April 1959 

Additional Protocol to the European Convention on Mutual Assistance in 
Criminal Matters, done as Strasbourg on 17 March 1978 

United Nations Convention against Illicit Traffic in Narcotic Drugs and 
Psychotropic Substances, done at Vienna on 20 December 1988 

Council of Europe Convention on Laundering, Search, Seizure and 
Confiscation of the Proceeds from Crime, done at Strasbourg on 8 November 
1990 

Agreement between the Government of Ireland and the Government of the 
United Kingdom Concerning Mutual Assistance in Relation to Criminal 
Matters, done at Dublin on 26 November 1998 

Protocol to the Convention for the Protection of Cultural Property in the Event 
of Armed Conflict, done at The Hague on 26 March 1999 

Articles 13, 14, 18, 19 and 20 of the United Nations Convention against 
Transnational Organised Crime, done at New York on 15 November 2000 

Second Additional Protocol to the European Convention on Mutual Assistance 
in Criminal Matters, done at Strasbourg on 8 November 2001 

Articles 46, 49, 50 and 54 to 57 of the United Nations Convention against 
Corruption, done at New York on 31 October 2003 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

31 December, 2020. 

SIMON COVENEY, 

Minister for Foreign Affairs. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [718]

title: 2020)) after consultation with the Minister for Justice, hereby order as follows:
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This Order designates the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern 
Ireland for the purposes of mutual assistance between the State and the United 
Kingdom under the Criminal Justice (Mutual Assistance) Act 2008 (No. 7 of 
2008), in accordance with the relevant international instruments set out in the 
Schedule to the Order. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [718] 5
